revision.text:
{{About|the Canadian comedian|other people|Craig Campbell (disambiguation)}}
'''Craig Campbell''' (born 1969) is a [[Canadians|Canadian]] [[stand-up comedian]], who now lives in [[Devon]], [[England]].<ref>http://www.ffwdweekly.com/Issues/2004/0219/comedy.htm</ref><ref>http://www.citylife.co.uk/comedy/features/12686_craig_campbell___canadian_wildman</ref>
==Career==
Campbell was the host of ''Ed's Late Night'' and ''From Wimps to Warriors''. He was also part of a comedy trio called The Dinks, with [[Tony Law]] and [[Dan Antopolski]].<ref name="Laughs">http://www.justlaugh.co.uk/comedians/Craig_Campbell.html</ref> He also appeared with Dennis Miller on ''Mountain Madness'' and performed with 'Jim Carrey Live'' and on ''[[Just for Laughs]]''.
In the UK he has appeared on ''[[Russell Howard's Good News]]''<ref name="Craig Campbell on Russell Howard's Good News on YouTube">https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Gjjsmx4_ce4</ref> on [[BBC Three]] and with [[Al Murray]] on ''Edinburgh & Beyond''. He also appeared in the second series of ''[[Michael McIntyre's Comedy Roadshow]]'' on [[BBC One]].
In November 2008 he toured Kazakhstan with UK comic Nick Wilty, performing in Almaty, Aktau and Atyrau.<ref name="Laughs"/>
He supported [[Frankie Boyle]] on his 2010 UK tour and performed his debut stand-up tour in 2011.<ref name="Craig Campbell announces first tour">http://www.moosefucker.com/index.html</ref> He opened for Boyle on his 2012 tour.
He appeared on ''[[Dave's One Night Stand]]'' in April 2011, with [[Chris Addison]] and Jo Enright. <http://uktv.co.uk/dave/series/tvseries/254381>
In November 2015 Craig performed in Moscow, Russia.
Campbell hosts a monthly comedy night in Tiverton, Devon.<ref>[http://www.comedyhall.co.uk/]</ref>
==DVDs== * ''Death of a Badger'' (2010)
